forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 51. West southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West wind 5 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a serene, partly cloudy night envelops the city, with temperatures lingering around a pleasant 51 degrees. As night yields to early morning, a gentle west-southwest breeze stirs, barely whispering through the quiet streets. The glow of the city is muted under the soft, cloud-draped sky, casting a tranquil ambiance that invites the night owls to wander.

As day breaks, Thursday promises to unveil a canvas of mostly sunny skies. The air will gradually warm to about 65 degrees, settling back to around 63 by afternoon—a subtle dance between warmth and coolness that defines our coastal charm. The gentle west winds will have their say, oscillating between 5 to 12 mph, adding just enough movement to the atmosphere, keeping the air fresh yet inviting. While the marine layer may whisper along the edges of the bay, obscuring the distant outlines of the Golden Gate, downtown itself will likely remain clear, illuminating the streets for those who venture out.

Given these conditions, dress in layers: a light jacket will serve well against the morning chill, transitioning into something more comfortable by lunchtime as the sun earns its place in the sky. Stroll along Market Street, appreciating the interplay of light and shadow as the city awakens. Perhaps find a nook in one of the local cafes to savor a steaming cup of coffee or tea, watching the world meander by. Alternatively, a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero, enjoying the fresh spring air and the gentle sounds of the bay, offers a quiet retreat amidst the bustle of urban life.
